isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 11 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTO-1X707LL/DLL/MLL AND RTO-1X709MLL MODELS - ASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY (1X707 MODELS)

svcproc.title: MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY (1X707 MODELS)
svcproc.para: Each mainshaft gear must have its I.D. snap ring installed before placement on the mainshaft.

Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to the mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with gear hub clutching teeth. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each mainshaft gear.
Axial clearance (end-play) limits are .006" to .015" (0.15 to 0.4 mm) for all mainshaft gears.

If the axial clearance is less than the minimum .006" tolerance, the limit washer should be replaced with a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the axial clearance is greater than the maximum .015" tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed. This will decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

step1.para: If previously removed, install the corresponding snap ring in the mainshaft gear I.D. ( Figure 147).
With mainshaft pilot-end down, secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks ( Figure 148).
If previously removed, install the roll pin in keyway ( Figure 148).
Position the 2nd speed gear limit washer (white) in the mainshaft 1st or bottom groove with washer flat side up. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 149).

Start at the mainshaft bottom and install a plastic air line in the keyway to lock the washer in place. As limit washers and gears are installed, continue to push the plastic air line up ( Figure 149).
Install the 1st-2nd speed gear sliding clutch, aligning the missing sliding clutch internal splines with the mainshaft key ( Figure 150).
With washer flat side up, position limit washer in next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 151).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on the mainshaft.
Install the splined washer ( Figure 151).
Install 1st speed gear, engaging the spacer external splines with the gear clutching teeth ( Figure 152).
Install LO speed gear on the mainshaft against 1st speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 152).
Install the splined washer, engaging the washer external splines with the gear clutching teeth ( Figure 153).
Install the limit washer with the stepped side up. Rotate the washer and slide the plastic line up to hold 1st and LO speed gears ( Figure 154).
Insert a .006" feeler gauge and a .015" feeler gauge between the gear hub and mainshaft spacer ( Figure 155). If out of tolerance, change the limit against the mainshaft spacer.
Install the LO-reverse speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing sliding clutch internal spline with the mainshaft key ( Figure 156).

figure.caption: Figure 156. Align Sliding Clutch With Mainshaft Key

step1.para: With the washer flat side up, position the reverse gear limit washer (white) in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 157).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft.
Remove the air line and insert the mainshaft key ( Figure 157).

note.para: Be careful not to move the gears while doing this procedure.
The limit washers are unlocked and can rotate which would cause the gears to drop.

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft from the vise and install with pilot end up. Install a splined washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 158).
Install 2nd speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the spacer external splines ( Figure 159).
Install the 3rd speed gear or overdrive on the shaft against 2nd speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 159).
Install the spacer in 3rd speed gear, engaging the spacer external splines with the gear clutching teeth ( Figure 159).

Install the 3rd speed gear tolerance washer on the mainshaft, washer flat side down and against the spacer. Rotate the washer in the mainshaft 4th groove to align the washer splines with the mainshaft splines ( Figure 160).
Install the short mainshaft key in the keyway ( Figure 161).
Check the axial clearances and make adjustments, if necessary ( Figure 161).
Remove mainshaft assembly from vise. Install splined washer for reverse speed gear on the mainshaft ( Figure 162).
Install reverse gear on the mainshaft. Engage the gear clutching teeth with spacer external splines and sliding clutch. Move the reverse gear against the 1st speed gear ( Figure 162).

On the shaft front, align the sliding clutch missing internal spline with the mainshaft key and install the 3rd-Drive gear sliding clutch. Engage the sliding clutch external splines with the 3rd speed gear clutching teeth ( Figure 163).

note.para: Make sure reverse gear is against 1st speed gear, the mainshaft key is in the keyway, and the 4th-Drive gear sliding clutch is engaged into 4th speed gear.
